title: RADIATION DIAGNOSIS APPARATUS
summary: <SOH> BRIEF DESCRIPTION OF THE DRAWINGS <EOH>FIG. 1 is a block diagram of an exemplary configuration of an X-ray diagnosis apparatus according to a first embodiment; FIG. 2 is a flowchart of an exemplary procedure in a process performed by the X-ray diagnosis apparatus according to the first embodiment; FIG. 3 is a first drawing for explaining the first embodiment; FIG. 4 is a flowchart of a procedure in a reconstructing process performed by a three-dimensional reconstructing unit according to the first embodiment; FIG. 5A is a second drawing for explaining the first embodiment; FIG. 5B is a third drawing for explaining the first embodiment; FIG. 6 is a drawing for explaining a modification example of the first embodiment; FIG. 7 is a block diagram of an exemplary configuration of an X-ray CT apparatus according to a second embodiment; FIG. 8 is a drawing for explaining a reconstructing process performed by the X-ray CT apparatus according to the second embodiment; FIG. 9 is a drawing for explaining a reconstructing process performed by an X-ray CT apparatus according to another embodiment; and FIG. 10 is a block diagram of an exemplary configuration of a Single Photon Emission Computed Tomography (SPECT) apparatus according to yet another embodiment. detailed-description description="Detailed Description" end="lead"?
abstract: A radiation diagnosis apparatus according to an embodiment includes reconstructing circuitry. The reconstructing circuitry reconstructs three-dimensional medical agent distribution images in a time series from a group of acquired images acquired in the presence of a medical agent by an imaging system from directions in a range that makes it possible to reconstruct three-dimensional images of a subject, by performing an iterative reconstruction process that uses at least one selected from between spatial continuity of the medical agent and temporal continuity of the concentration of the medical agent as a constraint condition.
